CONJUGATES: fakes (n.) | faked (v. past tense/part.) | faking (v. present part.)
ETYMOLOGY: Mid 19th century, perhaps from criminal slang, possibly related to Low German faken (to seize, handle) or Yiddish fayk (trick, deception).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Not genuine; being an imitation intended to deceive or be taken for the authentic item.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 假的，伪造的，非真实的；意图欺骗的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The police confirmed that the documents were entirely fake.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 警方证实这些文件完全是伪造的。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A fraudulent imitation of something valuable; a forgery or sham.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 赝品；仿制品；冒牌货；伪造物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He spent thousands on a diamond that turned out to be a fake.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他花了几千美元买了一颗结果是赝品的钻石。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To falsify or copy something; or to simulate an action or emotion so as to deceive.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 伪造；仿造；假装；装作（以欺骗）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She tried to fake an illness to avoid the meeting.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她试图装病来躲避会议。
